>>33783910
>Are you a polymath?
Ummm...... Maybe. Okay yes I am a polymath (also commonly referred to as a "Renaissance man") I just prefer not to always talk about it or want to sound airheaded (because I know it sounds airheaded). I've been told I'm a polymath by tons of people throughout my life initially to my surprise but I think I just get bored quickly and need to keep things fresh (or become depressed).

I pick up roughly 3 new hobbies every year, start a new collection every few years. I finished college 2 years quicker than average while still partying 3-4 weeks/night and powerlifting everyday, then decided to get a master's in the following year. I end up leading almost every friend group I've ever been in. I'm working in a fairly rigorous field (while also leaving another rigorous field) while also trying to start a business in an emerging field that barely exists right now. The only field I've always had trouble with is language but I still know 3 (English, decent Italian, and shitty Spanish) and have always believed being able to read people's subtle body language is much more important for communication than what they say.

Personally I think it keeps things fresh to pick up new things as much as you can and the more fields one indulges in, the more you can blend them into something new or something from a totally unrelated field would help significantly with whatever dilemma is faced in another.

But none of that matters if one either isn't happy, isn't able to love others and themselves, or can't share their interest and knowledge with someone else.

Simple extraterrestrial life such as algaes, planktons, amoebas, maybe even simple surface vegetation, is probably very common- maybe even abundant. Not the guy you were responding to, but wouldn't the issue with finding archeological evidence from the Richat structure be that, going by the flood myths and the geological evidence of flood flow rippling in the dirt and sand of the area, the flood was sufficiently catastrophic in nature that nothing is left in the original location? IF the Richat structure was indeed the city of Atlantis, then the flood which came in the form of a massive rush of water from the east (along the Atlantean mountain range) would have washed over the location, grinding millions of tons of stone, dirt and whatever other detritus, carrying it all over to the western shores of Africa.

In short, if anything at all would have survived such a cataclysmic event, it would all probably be under tens of meters of mud and rock in the seabed. And that seabed itself could be spread out in whatever direction from the African coastline for who knows how many kilometers.

You've surely seen what happens to giant stones and whole houses in China or Pakistan whenever the local river decides to flood again. Half the city is gently flowing down the river in those videos. Just scale those river floods up by a few orders of magnitude and you'll have something approximating the mythical flash floods that swept the worlds in those days. There's nothing to be found at the Richat structure. It's all either ground up into dirt undiscernible from any other random handful of rock and clay or it's buried under the Atlantic.

I only had it once.

I always sleep with the TV on and woke up one night at 2AM with the TV on like normal, and went back to sleep.

Then I wake up at 4AM, the TV is off, but I assume the power went out or something and go back to sleep.

Wake up, now it's 2AM again, the TV is on but it's static. I was about to go back to bed when I realized it was 2AM again, and then I had this sinking feeling like something was wrong. Then I felt like something was watching me, from the corner of the room by the door. I looked and saw the corner was darker than the rest of the room. That's when I realized it must be sleep paralysis because I can't roll over, I can only lay there so I just closed my eyes until I fell asleep again since I didn't want to see whatever it was in the corner.

Wake up again, now it's 4AM and the TV is off.
Fall back asleep until 11am and the TV was still off but I got out of bed.

posts.name: The Nobody
posts.com:
>>33771353
>why is the whole thing tied to feeling dread?
Emotions are created by the brain in response to physical sensations, and they are modulated by the context in which they are felt. Dread however, is only in small part an emotion. It is largely a pain reflex and an attention modifier. This is what makes dread so difficult to deal with, it amplifies its own emotional context.

As for why sleep paralysis is comes with dread, it's because of the physical discomfort. You are restrained, your heart is stressed, and your breathing is strained. Through proper attention and awareness all of these physical discomforts can be lessened / ignored. The dread can dissipate, and it can even become a thing of the past. These were my experiences.

posts.name: The Nobody
posts.com:
>>33771502
>what you mean by "attention modifier"?
That's the most important part. Dread restricts one's attention and generally produces paranoid thoughts as a consequence. Simply calming down is often not enough to counteract the demand dread puts on one's attention. There is a mastery of focus that comes in to play as well.

posts.com:
I have had experiences that I would like to understand.

I heard from a tv show that sleep paralysis happens when you wake up from a nightmare.

I have experienced waking up from a nightmare with sleep paralysis and a sense of a threatening presence, perhaps a looming darkness or dark figures and a feeling of fear. That all went away when I had asserted my will and managed to move, breaking out of that state.

However, I also experienced something else when I was a child.

Sometimes while trying to fall asleep, shadowy figures dragged me to a flaming pit blocking the doorway to my room and down the "fire hole" (as I called it as a child) into a nightmare. I had nightmares multiple times a week, and this is how many of them began, like a frame tale.

I was scared, suffering, and losing sleep. That may be how my insomnia started. I could run to my parents to tell them and get a hug, but I still had to escape from these nightmares that I occasionally got dragged into by figures similar to the presence or presences I sensed during sleep paralysis.

I started lucid dreaming as defense against all the nightmares, and sometimes I could control the dream. Usually after going lucid, I wake up, because I realized that I was dreaming.

Sometimes I would get stuck in a nightmare and have fight to get out. One time I was stuck in like Escher Battlezone 2 (from like Win 95) but all the lines were burning red, and there were dark figures that looked like the ones that dragged me into that nightmare. I thought they wanted to keep me there and hurt me. So I imagined summoning a tank, (I was like 10 so a tank seemed like the most powerful option even in the non-euclidian geometey of the landscape, plus it's mobile.) So i blasted the presences (honestly they looked like straight up Grays except red and black instead of gray.)

I have varied dreams now and few nightmares, and sometimes I lucid dream. I am also schizoaffective but that was not until I turned 29. Mabye irrelevant.

The entity is something you manifest in your mind because you are afraid, what is happening is that you wake up but your body is still asleep so you can't move and because you cannot move you become scared. in this in-between sleep state where you are alert but your body is sleeping, you can have waking dreams.
There is no entity sitting on your chest, you're seeing it a dream, while you are awake.

It is easy to become afraid when you can't move like you expect to be able to, but once you start feeling fear, the manifestations of your dream will simply compound that feeling as they would with any other feeling.

hope this helps!

posts.com: I have really only one experience with this. In my teen years I fell asleep listening to a podcast. I was having a very lucid dream of walking in a big, misty, beautiful architectural expanse with white tile and fountains and the like, still listening to this podcast (the audio was coming through into the dream). Suddenly I'm in back in room, in my closet, out of my body, this no longer feels like a dream but the real location. Still can hear the podcast. Then I'm instantly pulled back into my bed, and there is now a woman sat at a desk at the edge of my bed, her face was obscured by an indefinite object like a laptop or typewriter. I can feel her watching me. This paralyzed me and I just laid there still listening to the podcast until the experience ended. Was definitely spooked having never had an experience like this before and only vaguely knowing about sleep paralysis as a phenomenon that existed, definitely knew nothing about out of body experiences and I feel like if I hadn't been desk-hagged and allowed to move around freely I probably would've been super mindblown, especially since I was a total atheist at the time and for years after. Experience did always stick with me though as being very strange and supernatural feeling.

posts.com:
SP victim here.
The shadow creatures seldom show up. Sometimes they are there, but hidden. How do I know? They float objects, or place objects near my bed.
When they show up, they feel like automatons. Like a hologram movie. They don't react to yelling, and they are transparent to punch and kicks. Sometimes they have a face, other times they are like a thick smoke without shape. Color is the absolute darkest black.

The entire phenomenon follows a pattern:
> Bad breathing, blocked nose (low oxygen to the brain)
> Sleeping looking upwards (avoid: spirits are atracted by this)
> Coming out of REM phase faster than usual, that is, just after a dream (fucked up circadian cycles can cause this)
> A tremor inside the ear
> Room is exactly like real one but in black and white
> Cannot move much, if at all
> Low conscience level, enough to not to feel too much fear

How to get out:
Option a) Call Jesus. Works 100% of the times.
Option b) Find what part of the body you can control, move it, and amplify it until the movement awakens you.

for each person there is a unique path, but it always involves some form of suffering because the first stage of enlightenment is graduating from third to fourth density. for me, it required failing at my desired career overseas and becoming isolated while enduring a whole gamut of strife. by the time your low enough and your ego has been reduced to rubble, you will either make the choice of taking your own life or extricating oneself from "me" and realizing "we" and comprehending synchronicity and the bilateral nature of the mind.

then its time to move from 4th into 5th. this means learning and understanding love. people usually get stuck here thinking they figured it all out but remain quite emotional and capricious as a result. eventually you'll reach another satori upon witnessing and comprehending mistakes and attachments involving love and misconceived ideas of love.

then its 5th into 6th. here you will comprehend wisdom, and by that i mean knowing when to use love and how to use it appropriately. again, after screwing up x amount of times you'll discover the give and take nature of love and the reciprocal flux of this force emanating from God. Here you will finally comprehend that all is mind.

6th density so far is a stage in strengthening and understanding the power of mind and knowing when and how to apply ones mind. life is in ones control and at this stage it's learning how to balance and raise others. it's the stepping stone to a higher dimension, which I believe is only achievable after leaving this material plane on planet Earth.


These are the stages of "enlightenment". Take your time, don't care about being high. It's about learning and improving. Enjoy each stage. All have their novel, memorable moments. most importantly, don't give up and do your best and dont be hard on yourself. enjoy your life and give your love to the best of your ability and don't burn yourself out either.

posts.com: >Along with Vicharasangraham (Self-Enquiry), Nan Yar (Who am I?) constitutes the first set of instructions in the Master’s own words. These two are the only prosepieces among Bhagavan’s Works. They clearly set forth the central teaching that the direct path to liberation is Self-enquiry. The particular mode in which the enquiry is to be made is lucidly set forth in Nan Yar. The mind consists of thoughts. The ‘I’ thought is the first to arise in the mind. When the enquiry ‘ Who am I?’ is persistently pursued, all other thoughts get destroyed, and finally the ‘I’ thought itself vanishes leaving the supreme non-dual Self alone. The false identification of the Self with the phenomena of non-self such as the body and mind thus ends, and there is illumination, Sakshatkara. The process of enquiry of course, is not an easy one. As one enquires ‘Who am I?’, other thoughts will arise; but as these arise, one should not yield to them by following them , on the contrary, one should ask ‘To whom do they arise ?’ In order to do this, one has to be extremely vigilant. Through constant enquiry one should make the mind stay in its source, without allowing it to wander away and get lost in the mazes of thought created by itself. All other disciplines such as breath-control and meditation on the forms of God should be regarded as auxiliary practices. They are useful in so far as they help the mind to become quiescent and one-pointed.

ok here you go:
-vulgar materialism is the "philosophical" position that there is nothing except the physical universe and the forces which act inside it
-until recently there was more or less a consesus for creationism (the position that god or gods created the world) for the most part due to the lack of alternative explanations and philosophical proves for the existence of god
-with Kant these proves for god fell out of favor and with evolutionary theory etc there are now viable "atheist" alternatives with explanatory capabilities
-the mind-body problem is (shortly summarized) the question how physical and mental can interact if they are different substances; vulgar materialism has still no sufficent answer for this problem and so you can consider it maybe as the last prove for god that still stands (descartes argued that only godly intervention could make mental and physical interact)
-but due to lack of evidence generally the ockhams razor (easier explanation) for everything are natural ones and not ones that involve god

Does this clear things up for you. mate?

What you mention as the mind-body problem is no longer relevant. I'm not sure we'll ever attain a fine understanding of how our brain works, but we now know enough to eliminate the idea that consciousness and reason are somehow alien entities.

The mind is simply the workings of a biological organ operating within its limitations. Damage specific parts of it, and the mind will change in predictable ways.

Claiming there are parts of existence we don't understand is more than adequate. Saying these are due to supernatural entities is another story.

There is no evidence against atheism. Belief in the supernatural is just that, belief.

>>33788704
You might want to look up the significations of the 12th house. It tends to refer to enemies, sickness, loss, isolation and self-undoing. It can refer to unconscious suffering that requires effort to tackle. Saturn is in its joy in this house so some of its effects may be reduced.
In practical terms, a 12th house placement could mean a million things - it could mean you have problems with authority (especially with Saturn there) or a rebellious character or loneliness or anxiety (again, especially with Saturn there). Sometimes it can signify powerful enemies - some great men in history known for their relationship with their nemeses had significant 12th house placements. The 12th house is a bad house, but how bad it is exactly depends on the sign of your placements, which you do not know.
The same applies to Venus. Usually it is a helpful planet that grants luck and fortune, especially in a night chart like yours. However, you do not know what sign Venus is in, so we cannot determine whether Venus is going to be very helpful (for example, if it is in Taurus) or whether it is going to be almost completely useless (for example, if it is in Virgo). Depending on how your chart shifts because of time and degree placements you may also get different aspects to Venus that might help or hinder - for example a Mars square Venus in Virgo would probably suck. Long story short, go to a professional astrologer. Or go get your birth records from your local administrative centre or whatever it is.

>>33789468
In the past, the planets were called "wandering stars", because they appeared to be stars in the sky whose position noticeably changed over time, i.e. were moving.

These were opposed to "fixed stars", which are in our common parlance just stars; they don't seem to move, they seem to remain where you intially found them forever, although they do change their position extremely slowly over a long span of time.

Fixed stars, for the sake of your understanding, are a class of astrological bodies which remain at about the same degree over the course of a lifetime; they do not orbit the sun, they exist far away in other systems.

And yet they do exert an astrological influence upon Earth all the same. There is speculation about to what extent. It is agreed that the influence can be seen when you observe how they aspect your planets, AC, and MC, but some say only when they conjunct, and more strictly still say only when the orb (i.e. distance) is within one degree.

It is an underexplored area of astrology; you will hear little about them because they overload a typical "astrologer's" mind; such find it too taxing to read charts with more than the major planets and a couple asteroids.

posts.sub: The philosophy of AI generated art
posts.com:
Let's discuss the philosophical postures about this as it's obvious this will shape our beliefs in the coming times:

Position 1: AI generated art, although impressive lacks the experience and effort which makes human made art a unique journey and experience born from your own effort, it's a bit of tourism logic, you could come to the point were you get the VR system to travel to, say, the Pyramids, but you want the real thing both to say you did it without the help of any technological replacement

Position 2: AI generated should be embraced because it allows even those without much skill to create and share their dreams, like mass production allowing everyone to have smartphones, you no longer need to put that much effort, just learn to work with the AI and it will do most of the heavy lifting and you always expect the next patch to make it even better

Position 3: AI generated shows there is nothing special about humans, there is no spark of genius, no spiritual existence, no nothing, also it will make people you dislike suffer and become easy targets and eventually destroy all the degenerate art.

Personally I believe I, despite being from IT and management, orbit more towards position 1 in the sense I feel a great deal of what we experience is the effort to achieve it, I know it sounds weird for some westerners who just want to push the button but I guess I am a bit of a trad there, on the other hand I actually like the fact I can also call upon the machine whenever I need something fast and in abundance, and it certainly forces people to adapt and improve themselves looking for workarounds.

I find the people in Position 3 are in need of serious psychological help as it somehow hints a lot of self-loathing and lack of empathy.

But the soul is imparted to you
God is the whole, and your little fragment of the whole is obtained through your programming, you being impressed with the archetypes.
A machine able to carry this language will interact using the same filters and ciphers and understanding that we would.

I think much of our own intelligence is simply the natural interactions of these things we have built up. Our own minds are just something fragments of these play around in, and our own selves are just different permutations of lesser or greater quantities and variants of these things as circumstance distributed them to us.

Basically enough information interacting with itself creates sentience and a soul, and symbols are just incredibly information-dense, so that the most basic of human thoughts is actually something that would take a traditional computer unimaginable time to fully parse through. Our own language can not transmit these symbols to each other but only reference and activate them within one another, so we can not directly program them into a machine. But if we are able to somehow, we can give the machines a soul.

Machine learning may be a rudimentary step into 'how to get the symbols into the machines'. It is at least starting with something like we use for programming ourselves. the machines do not store hard information on these symbols but rather they store the product of countless iterations of comparison. The machines are unable to have coherent linguistical output of exactly what these symbols are, as are we. Seeing some of the flaws or inexplicable quirks that pop up in some models is that the finished symbol is a convoluted mess of strange associations, just as they are for us (how complexes form).

Im not sure if there is some fundamental flaw in how our computers work that means they will never be able to 'really' have souls, but at the very least i think they will be able to approximate a soul convincingly.

>>33767500
From my research, which admittedly is still in a pretty primitive stage, the Early Church Fathers would scoff at modern attempts at interpreting the Book of Revelations. They views the end times not as a definite point in history (Tribulation) but as the whole period in which the church waited for Christ. Therefore, the Book of Revelations was not prophecies about a series of events that would occur all at once, but a warning about the hardships that Christians would experience before Jesus returned. The only things God guarantees will occur before his return being the preaching of the gospel in every nation (Matthew 24:14, Mark 13:10) and the conversion of the Jews unto Christ (Romans 11:25-26). On the other hand, figures of Revelations (The Beast, the Anti-Christ) were embodied in different individuals throughout history (Hadrian, Diocletian, Attila, Frederick II). In this framework, Christs coming was something that could occur at literally any moment, as the extent to which these things had to come to pass could only be known by God. Therefore, Christians did not dread a coming apocalypse but hopefully anticipated the potential return of Christ at any moment. The modern interpretation of revelations, that we were approaching a coming end of the millennium in which the book of revelations was foretelling a series of events that would hearken Christs, arose in the nineteenth century and now proliferate in evangelical and traditional Catholic Circles.

If you are interested in the subject, I found some commentaries by Saint Victorinus, Bede, and Alcuin here: https://sites.google.com/site/aquinasstudybible/home/revelation I haven't looked through them anymore than verifying they are legit.

Otherwise, Augustines "City of God" and a number of Medieval works of history cover the topic of the Final Judgement as well.

>Age (round it to 5 steps) 20,25,30, etc.
>Gender (no need to reveal it anymore, only if you want to)
>Feeling during dream
>Lucid? (yes or no)
>vision? (yes or no)
>SleepParalysis (yes or no)
>3rd or Ego person?
>Dream Type ?
>Happenings Type? ( Type or none)
>Dream itself:

Happenings Type:
Type A: Marks on your body,bruises,scratches
Type B: Knocking,cracking noises when going to sleep
Type C: Critters,Spiders,Worms etc. Found on your body
Type D: Puddle of Water in your Room
Type E: Moving objects, Objects falling over
Type F: Loud boom noices. Electrical discharges

Type. In order to give me the best occurence, i will now set it to types:
Type A: Dream happened during your normal sleep shedule
Type A1: Dream after your normal sleep shedule and going back to sleep and wake up again
Type B: Dream during a Nap
Type C: Nightmare only half or an hour into sleep (30-60 minutes)
Type D: Nightmare in the middle of the night (4+ hours)
Type E: Nightmare after normal sleep and you wake up in the morning with it. (6+ hours)
Type F: Double or Triple dream during the Night
Type G: Fever dream
Type Z: Dream lasts only 5-10 seconds. Very short.

Explanations:
Lucid= You are aware that it is a dream and you can act out yourself.
Vision= Super Clearly visible. It feels you are really there and its almost real.
Sleep Paralysis = Awake, but not able to move.

No real life names, use nicknames or Anon.

Please don´t use any memes and try to be nice.
Every person will be treated equally.

Be nice, stay classy and pray to Jesus and ask him for forgiveness. He is the only one and true way to everything you need to know about life.

I was having a semi-normal dream of which I cannot now remember. Suddenly I was transported to a completely different location.
There was a very tall white tower going up into the clouds (not really like picrel, but you get the idea), I was either told or just simply knew this was called the 'God Tower'.
I began to make my way up the stairs inside the building and then next I knew I was at the top, and I found myself in a room, kind of dark Victorian style inside, and I walked around it a couple of times.

At this point, I was either told or just knew that "I am now in control", and I suddenly became VERY lucid. I managed to increase the size of a deck of cards as if I were increasing the size of an image on Microsoft Word, by dragging the corners out.
I then noticed that taped on the small wooden drawers than lined one side of the room there were written instructions on how to control a lucid dream.
All I had to do was close my eyes, declare what I wanted (e.g. completely change the environment or have something in my hand open) open my eyes again and I had it. Had some fun messing around with this for a bit before the dream faded away.

The fact this was located at the top of the 'God Tower' that made it all the more interesting for me

I've already done so several times, but here you go.

Me and my friend drove to an isolated spot near a creek to do some drinking. We feel like we are being watched when we pull up and park. A few minutes later, all we are doing is watching behind us (parked backwards to the woodline) and I see a pale white form standing out from the darkness. It's skin was like dry old dusty leather with varicose veins that are blue. I freak the fuck out and tell my friend to drive away. As we drive away me and him see the damn thing run across the road. It was incredibly fast and I saw it just barely long enough to make out its form. It was tall, had skinny arms and legs and a unusually small but round head (compared to its body). We drive away a few miles and it fucking follows us down the road, it kept up with the car.

We park at a lit parking lot that had cameras over it. It pops up a few hundred feet in front of us near some bushes and an unlit road. We take some pictures but they are of a quite shit quality for a multitude of reasons. Picrel is the one picture we got that shows something, a pair of eyes.

After an hour we decide to drive to the center of town to a 24/7 gas station for water and human contact (it was 2AM at this point). We exit the parking lot but are stopped at a light before the main road. To my right is a Grove of trees. Friend says he saw something moving over there.

My eyes adjust and I see the upper portion of its head peaking from behind a tree. It was staring directly at me. It eyes seemed huge but it was in fact it's eye sockets which absorb almost all incoming light. I couldn't look away and after a minute of probably the most horrifying, traumatic experiance of my life, I tell my friend to drive away. The moment I could no linger sustain eye contact I broke down into tears for about 30 seconds.

Words cannot fully describe how terrifying and evil these things are, and I had the luxury of encountering it from the safety of a car!

grew up in canada, and we had a channel called YTV, I think it's still around. But anyway, there was this show back in the mid 90s, with these 3 puppets, I think they were white and they each had different colored hair that was made from sparkly tassels or something. Anyway, there was a red one which I think was the leader, a blue one and a green one. For some reason I think they were a "band" or something. Only thing I can remember is them kinda bouncing around on a puppet stage thingy, with their hair flying all around. Very hazy memories of them, I've tried finding the show over the last 2 decades but I cannot find anything relating to it.
So, onto the good stuff. Around 1994 to about 1997 at the old house I lived in as a young kid, I would have these nightmares every night of these three. I am 30 now and can still remember some of them vividly. These dreams always felt very real and I always dreaded going to bed every night because I knew they would come.
They always started off with me in bed waking up at some point in the middle of the night after my mom had gone to sleep. I had a night light on and always had my radio on with the oldies channel on, so old boomer music from the 50's and 60's would be playing. So, I would awake in my racecar bed, which was facing the bedroom door and the only light would be from my night light, so pretty dim. I could see the hallway, the white walls were always a sorta nighttime blue hue and then blackness at the end of the hallway where the bathroom was with the stairs to the main floor off to the left. I would always be awake for a few moments and then I would hear voices coming from down stairs, like whispering voices, like mischievous they were up to no good. They would be talking coming to get me. Then I would hear running up the stairs and the three "puppets" from the show would come running from around the corner of the stairs into the hallway into my room to get me. I would wake up every time. Cont.

I always hate these threads because I put a lot into what I write and no one replies but whatever.

Ill keep them short and sweet then. These are the ones that really stick out.

One dream turned nightmare has me running first person through a nice neighborhood on a windy spring day. However all of these houses were right next to each other, only divided by their fences with a bit of yard grass in between.
I turn around and look to see a tornado forming above me, I make a quick decision to break into someones home to seek shelter.
Inside it was scary quiet, as if it was me in a void. I hear the sound of someone snoring off in the distance. I close in and notice an elderly Chinese man dressed in an ornate, red Chinese robe. The kind a Kung-fu grandmaster would wear. He looked to be napping sitting down on his couch, the living room was surrounded by authentic martial arts weaponry and ancient artifacts. I hear something crunch under my foot and before I could realize what it was I hear a deafening scream coming from the old man. Think those baby plants from Harry Potter. It all happened so fast, but in a matter of one second he gets up from his couch draws a bladed chained looking weapon and everything turns to black. I assume I died before I even hit the ground.

>>33781272
Another was where I was a king of some ancient Sumerian style city-state, surrounded by absurdly tall guard walls. About the size of a 15 story building.
After I take a tour of my city and met with all of my subjects ( I could tell I was a beloved leader that was trusted and respected, though I could also tell that some of the elderly and mature people seemed uneasy about something else going on)
I finally demanded my royal guard, after their many efforts to divert my attention, that I wanted to see what was beyond those walls.
They finally conceded, and led me to one of the doors opening to a winding staircase.
I reach the top and am heart struck by what I see.
Surrounded on all sides, approximately 3 miles(5 kilometers) of desolate no mans land separated us and an extremely hellish mountain range that encompasses our city full circle. The mountains were covered in dark black ash cloud with intermittent thunder illuminating the silhouette of jagged peaks and red hot hell.
They seemed to close in. I couldn't quite tell, but it seemed as it was creeping closer and closer.
I finally realized then what the walls were for.
I looked at my one guard accompanying me.
He looked defeated, almost as if he wanted to cry. We said nothing, but understood. There was nothing that could be done. We were all going to perish.

I had a dream-vision a while back where I was apparently a Soviet conscript in WWII.
I'm laying in a slight depression, surrounded by corpses, lots and lots of corpses.
It's raining shells.
There's some blown out ruins ahead of me at about 400 meters distance, and I can see what are apparently the enemy being silhouetted against the sky through the windows and cracks of the buildings.
It's cold and drizzling, the sky is grey, and the ground I'm laying on is muddy.
There's apparently an advance by them because then they're right up on top of me, < 20 meters. That's when I realize that I'm not the only one laying in that pile still returning firing.
There's movement as some of my guys jump up and are scurrying forward the best they can.
I'm real low on cartridges, so I call out, "Hey, anyone there, you got any ammo?!"
I recognize the face of the man that runs up to me, a personal friend, though at the time I can't quite place him.
He hands me eight cartridges, five on a stripper and three loose. I notice he's not carrying a rifle.
"Here comrade, make them count!"

the scariest dream i ever had was when i was 7. it was about blue aliens, it happened in 3 parts
part 1, i see a news broadcast talking about how blue aliens are planning on abducting people tonight
part 2, my mom and dad are sitting on the porch talking about the upcoming alien abduction, i eavesdrop on their conversation
part 3, i wake up in the middle of the night. i'm paranoid about aliens so i go to tell my dad that i can't sleep. i'm walking down the narrow hallway to my parents bedroom. their bedroom door swings open, and my grandma (who didn't live with us) is standing in the threshold holding a basket of laundry. i can basically only see her silhouette. i ask her what she's doing. she doesn't say anything, her eyes light up neon blue. she starts to pursue me down the hall. my mom emerges from the bedroom also with glowing blue eyes. they chase me, i try to run but they catch me easily. they shed their human disguises and reveal their true alien forms, they look like greys but they're a deep blue cor. they put something like a brown plastic shopping bag over my head and start dragging me. they drag me through my sisters bedroom where she's sleeping. they take me out of her window and we're beamed up to their ship. that's when i woke up.
other than that the only monster i can recall ever dreaming about is bigfoot

posts.com:
Back in the year 2012 I had an incredibly vivid nightmare about fighting machines.
I was somewhere I understood to be Northern California, near the coast. I was separated from my friends and family and fighting alongside a group of strangers. We had no uniforms, and there were women and unarmed people in our group. We looked like homeless people with guns.
Suddenly this huge, dark cloud of whirling flying machines comes over the horizon. It came up and over one of those big, steep hills like they have in San Francisco. Countless machines actually darkening the area with their shadows. They looked like the man hacks from Half Life 2.
There was so much fear and panic.
We started retreating inside this shitty looking building to hide. The windows were all boarded up and there were objects like mattresses and tables places against the walls and windows to make them thicker.
We understood somehow that the machines could see through walls and this was our crude effort to hide as deep inside the house as possible and avoid being seen. Walls bolstered by fucking mattresses and cardboard and whatever was there to sort of "muffle" their vision.
We put the women closest to center of the house and posted up with rifles behind over. I remember being aware of them coming by the windows and looking for us.
As the cloud of machines attacked, different parts of it split off and spread out down the alleyways and streets. It was like they all had one mind and each rotor thing was just a single digit of this gigantic organism. You could hear screaming off in the distance when they bore down on a particular house and discovered someone.
It wasn't until around 2020ish that I saw that Chinese footage of a drone swarms and recognized it from the dream.

>>33782355
Book suggestion for anyone interested: "Feeling Good" by Dr. David Burns (1989).

This is not a spiritual book. It is one of the most widely published books on cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT).

Regardless of your viewpoint on CBT or its effectiveness, the book gives readers some great concepts and tidbits to take with you. In a nutshell, CBT is about becoming aware of one's thoughts, recognizing limiting or self-defeating patterns, and choosing to replace and correct these patterns.

If there's one thing from the book that proved to be the most helpful, it's the list of 10 Cognitive Distortions. These can really help see where your thoughts and mind are holding you back, and for those with a more analytic mind like myself, it serves as a productive way to reverse unwanted thought patterns and give way to new patterns which are self-directed and "believable" since you're striking down the old pattern and proving to yourself why the new pattern is equally, if not more, true.

An example of a distortion is "Emotional Reasoning," which would be a statement such as "I can't do this, that means I'm a failure." In this statement, the person sees their failure to do one thing as a means to label themselves as a failure (see the I AM in there?).

There's an exercise to go through and list your thoughts, go through what you wrote, identify which distortions are there, and then have you explain why this thought is not the "truth."

to pay it forward, i'll give you two examples from my past to help boost your faith:

another was a girl i was super in to. we messaged each other back and forth, slow conversation didn't go anywhere (her end), and was disappointed but ended up forgetting about it. a year later, we match, and things go great. have 4-5 dates and felt a connection. then all the sudden, she doesn't want to see me. very confused, b/c in my experience, it went as well as anything i'd experienced before through that stage. a month or so later i tried following her on insta, seeing if she'd respond well, if not, whatever. she rejected it. then about a month after that i thought to myself, i WILL run in to her at some point, so be on my A game - i know when we're together in person everything goes seamlessly, she just sucks at messaging. that week, i see her in a parking lot, wave at her, she missed it, then sent her a text saying was that you?, and she says, hey i thought that was you anon but wasn't sure, and we go out like 10 times after that until she pulled the same bs again by leading me on.

what i'm saying is...things can and do break your way.

believe it or not, even when it may seem like it's not the case, the OTHER person can be just as nervous, if not more. she knows you're interested, and all the sudden she'll get a signal going off in her head telling her "i need to reach back out to anon before i blow it."

godspeed my guy

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>Letter 1 - 25th July 2005
Dear,
Thank you about your kind letter about the monster I spawned all those years ago. I have no idea who owns it, where its present incarnations rests, nor who profits from its sales to this day. Certainly not I, nor any of my former colleagues who worked on the game for about three years. One could almost say that it “died” under the same circumstances that gave it birth. One week it was #1 best selling game in the US, the following week Inscape folded and the game was buried. Conspiracy? I have no idea. I pulled the sequel Cult as I had no wish to return to the blood arena that is software publishing. No wish to return to that haunted city of Lost Angels. I feared that Cult had a dangerous side effect and the actions of Aum, The Solar Temple, and the Branch Davidians stayed my hand. I think it was a wise move. The world is too fucked up without me adding to it. I went back to writing children’s books and being an artist. But your letter is moving. I read it to my wife Mandy and she was pleased that somebody out there remembered it and enjoyed it. Drowned God was such a mammoth venture and it remains for me under the category of misunderstood. It’s beginnings were humble. A notebook that remained from 1983 when I penned the antique forgery The Diary of a Plagiarist and sold it (12 volumes) in the Cowgate, Edinburgh. A film of that episode was commissioned by Channel 4 but was once again thwarted. Ten years later I resurrected the basic premise for Drowned God. Time Warner bought the rights. The game was commissioned before the X-Files, suddenly what had seemed a left field minority interest was propelled into $3 million dollar flagship for Inscape. This was a pity, because it meant that much of what I had written was censored. Even the last realm of the game, Chokmah, is merely a 1/10 of what was made.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33772879
The military temples and underground bunkers were reserved for Cult. Where they are now I have no idea. I was locked out of my own game. Indeed, so much was cut that I fear the story made no sense. Perhaps there is a fitting justice to all of this. My partners in the construction of Drowned God were seduced by promises of great wealth. The English producer made secret deals with Time Warner for a bigger portion of the pot. Film deals, 5 book deals with Eranta, a record deal, etc. A paid for and promised engine to realise a personal route through the game, devised on the numerology of the Bequest Globe, failed to materialise. For the nine personality types there were nine pathways. Even the running order of the Realms was changed, with Binah starting the game, where the original game had begun with Chesed, the Mayan realm. My original storyteller in the game, the Relic Hunter (Richard Horne) was cut and only makes a brief appearance in Din. It was through this character that all loose ends were tied and explained. When the game came out it was critically hailed and panned at the same time. Loved or loathed, my favorite quote from Playboy(?) who said it made The Twilight Zone seem like Pee Wee’s Big Day Out, the game languished for a month with sales of 100,000 before disappearing.

I have never made a penny in royalties. But I still feel proud of my monster. Your letter reminds me of the same thrill that I had devising it. Recently I was approached by Rockstar (Grand Theft Auto: Vice City) to consider making Cult. My feelings for the moment remain the same, as I have said. Perhaps later… For now this is enough. Write back and perhaps we can continue our discussion. My sister lives in New York state in a place called Goshen. Mandy and I sometimes see my publisher in NY so who knows… A glass of absinthe for me. And we’ll talk it up a storm, Best wishes to you, Harry Horse “What were we if our souls have lived before; We teem as sand grains to our present shore, Yet all may be dust from some opening door!” – RH Orion, 1846

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>Letter 2 - 10th august 2005

Dear,
Your letter arrived this morning and awakened in me ideas that had for several years lain dormant. For the topographical inspiration for DG came from a dream and last night my dreams were disturbed by low visions of military temples and unholy crypts, shifting sands over barren deserts and forgotten decaying landscapes. Your letter added to the feeling that something in me had shifted and despite my resolution that this umbrageous legacy should remain closed, sealed, something in your perceptions about the horrific endings of Kether and Malchut was resurrected...
Perhaps my dreams are informed by my current nocturnal readings.
The Shadow Over Innsmouth by HP Lovecraft, a tale of mingled terror and fascination set in the decaying seaport towns of New England; fishy hybrids and ancient secrets locked in extraterrestrial vaults under the spume of troubled waters. All those abandoned wharves and warehouses crumbling into the sea. Crooked eaves and terror soaked inhabitants scuttling to preserve the secret from prying outsiders, all grist for the mill for my own febrile imagination, the foundations for which our nightmares are built upon. Blame myself for making that ground fertile, for allowing the seeds of horror to find dark soils worthy for those’ mares to take hold, but wether I read Mailer, Henry Miller or that mad mage the crafty one, still am I troubled. Like the ten year old boy I once was I enjoy scaring myself to sleep, though the waking moments at 3.am promise hat filled cranial machinations. I am a cosmanaut venturing into the unknown inner spaces of the unconcious. I bring back scattered fragments of the dream and try to weave some semblance of coherance.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33772895
The first dream in 1981 informed the making of 'Diary of A Plaguarist', the 18th century manuscript describing the fall of Atlantis and the subsequent cyphers of the secret, complete with the rival factions who vie for control. In those days my knowledge of the arcane and occult was minimal. The work was simply to acquire a sum from the pompous booksellers in the capital. I was poor and the income I generated as an artist was minimal. Finding blank papers in a drawer and soaking them in tea produced a pleasing antiquarian effect. My copperplate handwriting ( enclosed sample, only a copy I am afraid) and emulation of illustrations of that time provided decent subterfuge. I produced 11 chapters or manuscripts, thusly decorated. Each copy bound and sewn. Orange juice to culture a mould on the covers. Dust from the fireplace scattered on those mouldering covers. Greased endpapers mothballed and tinctured, even the smell was authentic. Let me explain that my real name is Richard Horne ( though for reasons I shall not enter into here I prefer to be recognised by my nom de plume) and for the purposes of disgusing the true authorship of these manuscripts I simply spelt that name backwards- hence Dracir Enroh, dated 1846.

The contents of the Diary were rambling and nonsensical. I was merely after the prize. Selling the diaries as they were produced very fortnight to a dealer called Armstrong. He was taken with the look of the books and offered me the sum of £ 50 for each one( a pittance, but fortune for me) on the understanding that I bring him all 12 in due time. He believed as I had told him that the manuscripts belonged to my father and were kept in a drawer of his bureau, and that it was necessary for me, so as not to arouse suspicion, that I remove them one by one, with a period of weeks between each theft. Colluding with me in this way I was given ample time to concoct the latest version.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33772902
At first the Diaries were concerned with the Blavatskian ramblings of the Theosopshists. As you have so rightly noted, the ramblings of the Relic Hunter, much given to discourse upon Atlantean airships and manimals. After three volumes cyphered in this manner, replete with diagrams and maps of the citadel, pages filled with Sumerian cryptograms and number codes, German expressionist poetry copied from unread books on the subject, I began to exhaust my small library and turned instead to filling the pages with diagrams from a nuclear fission handbook from a power station, engineering blueprints for aeroplanes and other delights into the handbook of a modern Nostradamus. Joyfull as this was to the japester in me, it was my final undoing. I had been carefull to select a bookdealer who dealt in bric-a-brac, rather than an authentic expert in antiquarian books. The inclusion of these groundbreaking discoveries whetted the appetite of Armstrong. This unpublished manuscript made the work of HG Wells seem like the blind musing of a pulp writer. Here, afterall, were the rudimentary and accurate sketches for a fission, nearly a hundred years before the discovery by modern science. Here, the dates of the two great wars and the descriptions of the vessels that would carry those dread payloads. Turn a page and see the blueprints for the aeroplane, the tank, the motor car. And unlinke Nostradamus, the names of the players. Not Hister but Hitler. Armstrong the dealer went to his fortune. He took my forgeries to a publisher.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33772906
I believe in synchronicity, not coincidence. The 23 Skidoo Principle. Schroedinger's Cat. Call it what you will. I should tell you that I was already a published author and illustrator in the employ of Canongate Publishers. Indeed I took some of the manuscripts there to be photocopied. I was working on drawings for 'Jekyll and Hyde' (pub. Canongate 1985) and would mix up these and the secretive workings of my efforts to preserve something of my labours - for posterity. Armstrong took my seven manuscripts to an expert called Dr.Black (I kid you not) who in turn took them to Christie's, the internationally held experts in the field of antiques - and rare manuscripts etc.

Now here is the strange part. Unknown to me there really was a writer called Richard Horne who was working in 1846. His most famous book is called Orion, a verse poem recalling the slaughter of the Sons of God by Diana the Huntress in Merope. He was born in 1803 and his last book written in 1884 was called 'Sithron the Star Stricken', subtitled, a 12th century manuscript discovered under the ruin of Solomon's Temple, translated from the ancient Arabic manuscript by Salem Ben Uzair (really Richard Horne). Orion was published in 1846. The expert was convinced that this was one of his forgeries of japes. Thrilled, Armstrong took my manuscripts to the first publisher he could find... Canongate. I was discovered ofcourse and prosecution was threatened. A deal was struck in the musty backroom of the shop. I was to provide the rest of the manuscripts at a reduced cost. It served me right I suppose. I only wrote up to the 11th Diary of A Plaguarist and then escaped to France.

Sithron begins thus :
'I pray the lord Christ's pardon, having found,
Something perhaps I should not, underground.
But human good and ill the mind alone can bond
If it shall change the arms, force, Art of War.
Extremes will come and end the bloody jar
And my space wandering ghost find its absolving star,
For days must dawn when men will tire of strife
And touch the trembling secret of this life
And catch a glimpse beyond with different wonders rife...'

Now I must return to my daily work though even writing this letter has whetted my appetite for further discussions. I am intrigued by your ideas. More...More..more. I can tell you that you would not have been dissatisfied with Chokma. Certain recordings by remote viewers on those underground labyrinths under White Sands and the Four Corner Area of New Mexico, Colorado, Utah and Arizona hold secrets that we cannot concieve of. Experiments in flesh, on animal and man. Who's now the nutter? Military temples and desert venom... The pigman is a Nostradamus quatrain. Perhaps it is a description of the gas masked biological warrior or else it is one of those Cayce inspired animals...transmuted flesh..the hybrid that my dear collegue Prof.Hapke from the University of Edinburgh spoke of in the taverns of the Cowgate. His theory, that could clear a room in minutes, was that the pig was a relative of ours, a mutant result of an ancient nuclear war described in the Maharrabata (Vishnus and Vhiminis, an Indian epic describing a war between the gods that vapourised elephants and armies into dust, flying chariots that were controlled by the pilot's mind alone) and that the food taboo associated with certain religions was an unconcious memory of this fact.

posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

close eyes (personally recommended)

posts.com:
I've been meditating for years now and yet I can't really put into words what meditation is, I like the "meditation is deliberate focus of awareness" thing that people usually talk about.

Cultivating the ability to focus takes time. Focusing on the breath or a candle are the 2 basic exercises people recommend, it teaches you to "feel" and "observe" which are different from "thinking", it may take months to snap out of the "thinking" mode for just a second but that sole second is enough to show you that your thinking mind is not you nor your reality, it's like a radio which plays all the time and you were living with that radio open for most of your life.

>>33699233
For me the "observer" focus/mode is when you are not a slave to your thoughts and you are calmer thus you don't get dragged away by them, while the "focus" focus is the ability to focus on one thing with all your might, I say that those 2 go hand-in-hand and maybe someone could say that they are the same thing: the ability to take a step back from everything, be calm and direct your focus/observing whatever you want.

Also during my sits I remember how to feel my feelings. Feelings inhabit your body and you can feel them better if you focus on them, they usually carry forgotten memories or various insights and blissful states if you focus on them enough.

Meditation is a paradox to me, it's like a means to an end but also the end itself, it's like a vehicle which takes you places but also it's just erasing all the unnecessary noise around you to realize that all those places were always here next to you.

So sit and watch your breath, feel your body breathing, your mind will make thousands of stories about anything but just let it be, don't even label those thoughts, don't even say "I'm letting them go", just let them be and focus on your breath, on the feeling of your body breathing, your mind will say "that's stupid, analyzing these important things is better", but just focus on the breath.

>>33710828
What you say makes sense but from my own experiences I 'd say that those 2 are the same thing.

Focusing is like an ability, people are good at it or not.

You can be focused on just this moment and your surroundings without being focused on a single object. This is like being totally present, you are focused on the present, your mind isn't wandering outside of your control, thoughts may pop up but they don't take you away in daydreaming (which most people have but don't realize). Imagine that this focusing ability is like a magnifying glass, let's say that what I just described is the point "zero" of the magnifying glass, our basic reality. This is what you called the "observer" mode.

However you can zoom into one single thing using that magnifying glass, say your breath or an object. You can literally move your entire consciousness towards that thing to the point that your awareness travels there, some people say that "wizards/shamans/yogis" can move their entire consciousness towards that object and move it with their will or inhabit the body of an animal, others say that they can zoom their eyesight so much to the point that they look at the atoms of an object, some even say that they hypnotize others through this way. This is the point "1" of the glass.

Conversely you can even zoom out, you can become the whole room and even look at yourself from above, you can become your whole house and the whole city, you can focus on the whole galaxy and the whole cosmos, you can even break the linear time illusion and realize that everything is one single moment which takes place here and now. Let's say that this is the point "-1" of the glass.

That's what meditation is: Realizing that you are everything at the same time, your awareness can go everywhere since you are part of the whole, the ego is an illusion, break free from it and realize that you are whole, ignore your thoughts which most of the time are just the ego talking nonsense.

>>33699233
This post made me want to share something semi-related - an experience of mine:

For years I always wondered if non-directive meditation is the same as directive meditation, or if one was better than the other or even the "correct way to meditate".

In the non-directive kind you just sit and be aware, if something pops up you just watch it until it goes away without making stories in your mind about it.

In the directive aka focus meditation you focus on a single object and you stay with it, if something else pops up you immediately return to the object.

After practicing both for a long time I can say one thing: They both have the same result which is your thinking mind eventually quieting down, the thoughts become less and less and you are left in silence and that's when the real fun begins.

(continued in the next post)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33726002
(cont.)

I could say that non-directive would be better suited for advanced practitioners who can manage their thoughts better and are better at not being dragged away from their wandering mind, those are the practitioners who are more grounded, whose their breath is 24/7 calm. That's the "observer focus" you are talking about.

Directive is better for people who are new to meditation, those people are usually overthinkers, their breath patterns are all over the place, I'd suggest that someone who begins meditation focuses on his belly expanding or his chest or on the feeling the air makes in his throat. I suggest this because in an overthinking beginner the thoughts are coming at a very fast and strong rate. Imagine this kind of meditation like you holding on a steel pole with all your might so the tornado (thoughts) won't drag you away. That's the "focusing focus" you talked about.

So it all comes down to having a calm mind, and sitting will do this anyway, sit in the dark with no sound or anything to bother you and the thoughts WILL stop, what really helps is if you also incorporate breathwork and physical exercise in your everyday life and if you reduce screen usage (which fills your mind with lots of information), these will help you reach the "no-thought" state faster.

I remember sitting down to do "Focus on breath" meditation and various memories and bad feelings popped up, I ignored them and returned to the breath, then thoughts like "You are ignoring what's important!" popped up and I became anxious that I was using meditation to run away from my problems but I knew that I wasn't really doing that and that was just my overthinking mind not wanting to stop. Most of our problems are just thoughts in our minds and are not real at all.

So just sit and focus on the breath or on the moment, or on your body, don't think too much about it, thoughts and words are not everything, feeling is also important, feeling this moment here now.

>>33700019
Start with objects that are in another room from where you are. Then move on to physical settings in the house, imagine whole rooms and whole layouts of the house. Next, move to things that are outdoors like a park, a lake, forest or other natural settings of the sort. After that move to more dynamic situations like a busy city center, a school campus between classes when there's a lot of people walking everywhere, a busy restaurant, etc. After than imagine scenarios with yourself and other people who are immediately with you where you give each person unique physical attributes, personality traits and have them say the certain things you want them to say.

Literally that simple. Should take you sometime.

>>33732995
Shut off your PC monitor, close your laptop, back away from the desk.

Sit up right but remain in a relaxed position. Close your eyes. Take a deep breath through your nose and feel as the air travels down through your lungs and you expand your belly to fullness. Holy for 3 seconds, then slowly exhale through your pursed lips. Repeat twice more. Feel relaxed and just let your thoughts flow. Don't get in their way, just let them happen, sit back and observe. Keep breathing normally through your nose and continue to let your thoughts happen, sit back and observe them. Do this for the next 5 minutes.

There. You've done mindfulness meditation and you are going to feel better after the 5 minutes are up. Do this for the next few weeks and write down any worries, anxieties, intrusive thoughts, or recurring themes that run through your mind while meditating.

That's literally all you have to know right now. Meditation is one of those things that are better of just experiencing from the get got instead of reading about them. You can do body scan meditations, mantra meditations, visualization meditation and KUNDALINI BRO later. No need to complicate things.

Keep reading and lurking the thread for resources.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33744644
I'm the same anon who said that quitting coffee helps, I'm here with new things you can consider:

- Maybe your volition is not that strong? Maybe you just sit and you hope that something happens? Maybe instead of trying to focus on your breath you half-ass it and your mind takes you over all the time? You have taken notice that you are indeed mind wandering, you have taken the first step of observing this - a step which many humans never take in their whole life - so why you don't act? Why your mind keeps on being the leader?

- Maybe your thoughts seem like they are extremely important and you can't ignore them? If yes then write them down after each session and really ask yourself: Is this important now? Most of the time it isn't, it's most likely a past semi-traumatic event which keeps on repeating in your head, or a worry about the future, ignore them both, the now is the most important thing.

- Maybe you are trying to focus on your breath through your thinking mind? That's too narrow, try to FEEL, like literally feel your whole body breathing, the breath fills your lungs only but it also moves your belly and your pelvic floor with its movements, your shoulder blades and clavicle may also move during inhalation/exhalation, feel your whole body sitting there and breathing.

- Speaking of the body, try to keep your head retracted (search about this head posture), also imagine a thread which is attached in the middle of your head pulling it lightly up, this head position helps with sleepiness.

- Again: Don't make a story about it, it's just you breathing, yes you will just sit there and feel yourself breathing, your mind will think "What? Only that? That's too simple/stupid/whatever", but believe me: first achieving calmness and silence is the most important thing.

- And last: Coffee is not the only thing which may hinder your meditation practice, everyday cannabis smoking or regular pills may hinder it too.

>>33744644
Everyone is saying that you should focus on your breath and maybe it works for some people but I will speak about my own experience: I was trying for years to concentrate just like you and I just couldn't, then I decided to just sit and accept in silence without trying to fight or force anything nor direct my focus 100% on something, just observe myself in silence.

I did that because I knew that I had unresolved childhood trauma inside of me, I was full of anger and anxiety most of the day and even during meditation, it was like a huge alarm which was ringing for years now and I wasn't doing anything about it.

This way of meditating did indeed have some kind of focus but it was more of a calm, "sit back and relax" kind of focus in which I was just being aware of everything that came, some people call this "transcendental meditation" or "mindfulness" I think.

So you could say that my object of meditation was my thoughts which were usually various past experiences which I had the tendency to remember all the time or even made-up scenarios. Nearly all of those thoughts carried hateful feelings with them and my mind wanted to live out those scenarios which they usually ended up in me beating up someone who had mistreated me, I had violence and hate inside of me (all from my abusive childhood).

However as I said before in my meditations I didn't sit to fight or force things but I sought to observe in silence, so every time this pull came, this pull towards violence - this pull towards making more thoughts and extending the scenario - I choose instead to just sit, and what I saw was fear that the other person was mistreating me and I wasn't doing anything, this feeling of fear was so strong which was almost unbearable and it took me many meditations to finally resolve it.

So as >>33744852 said, yeah I was probably using meditation as a way to escape those alarming feelings of hate and fear.

Maybe something similar is happening to you? Who knows.

Just sitting and watching, my mind/ego wanted to make scenarios e.t.c. but I just sat there and took all the thoughts along with the feelings that came with them AND I didn't give into the temptation of making those hateful scenarios in which I "rebelled against those who maltreated me".

I just sat there and relaxed and let everything take place, I was attentive and watched it all, with time I realized that it was mostly thoughts which were just replaying in my mind since childhood, I then went deeper into the feelings which came along with the thoughts and it was mostly feelings of feeling inferior and feelings of fear of being left outside with no home and family.

Many old forgotten memories started popping up, mainly from my abusive childhood house, in the beginning I didn't want to see the memories nor feel the feelings, I saw myself in my 7 year old form and I hated it, I didn't want to face my childhood. But with time and courage I did and then came meditations in which I was literally crying in the dark seeing my younger self being beaten to a pulp.

So yeah, it's all inside of you, just give it time and practice often, don't aspire to be wizard/yogi/superman or anything, be a loving person first - especially towards yourself. Most people want to become strong because they can't accept their weak side but the irony is that true strength lies in not fearing to be weak.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33754655
Another anon here. Night time meditations are hard because dreams mess things up, if this is a problem try morning and early evening meditations.
Dreams are not a reason to stop the session because most fascinating trance states can be found when almost falling asleep in meditation, but the goal of the session clearly changes.
At most repeat only once before progressing and later return back if you feel like it. The tapes are clearly too short so meditating before starting one or returning back to the beginning after a few minutes can help.

Despite starting with a restless mind I have had great success. The best parts have happened after the tape has ended, when it gets to the wake up part I disconnect headphones and keep going.
Meditative states aren't interrupted by simple actions, trance clearly vanishes for a bit when moving a hand around but it always comes back in like 15 seconds when ignoring the disruption.
Good dedication. If you have questions about the tapes don't ask them because you are thinking instead of surrendering to the relaxation, do what you feel like.

From all the years that I have been meditating I can say that deep relaxation, letting go, silence of the mind and concentrating on this moment here now (through whatever means, like concentrating on the breath, body, sounds or just concentrating) are just what is needed, everything else is just pure larping, ego chasing and dogmatism.

You just sit/walk/cook/work in meditation to just be and all will come, that's the paradox of: it if you chase it with your ego-based fears and wants then you won't get it, but if you sit still in silence then all the truth will be revealed to you, yes in the beginning you will receive some harsh truths like that you are a hypocrite, or that you are not the great person you thought you were, or that your sexuality was not the one you thought it was, or horrible forgotten memories may return etc but once you accept those initial truths then suddenly they will not hurt anymore and they will be gone, that's another paradox of life: if you run away from your fate then that fate will hunt you but if you sit still and accept that faith then it will magically transform.

Yeah wanting to hypnotize people and manifest cash is nice and all but in the end of the day something will always be missing and that something is the truth about what is really going on here.

So maybe be humble and ignore all the noise and just focus because it's all here in front of you and if you really ask for it then it will be reaveled.

The next time you incarnate, they will scratch their initial scripts which were designed by them for you, and replace it with the one you created for yourself.

This way, you have a significantly lesser chance at escaping from here because you are less likely to rebel against the status quo since you are the one who created this script for yourself by foolishly pursuing material worldly "success".

Like mentioned before, this iteration of the universe is probably not the first one. The first iteration was allegedly built to be a paradise for humans from the perspective of the AI machine.

But as it turns out, after engaging in all sorts of material bliss, humans eventually start sensing that "something is wrong", because something really IS wrong.

The core of the human spirit knows deep within that this is not normal and so eventually humans start rebelling against the system and attempt to escape it. This is when the AI realizes that its vision of a human Utopia is deeply flawed and doesn't work with the human spirit as planned.

As a result, the machine destroys the world and resets everything, makes some modifications and starts over and hopefully this time humans will not rebel and accept their artificial Utopia.

posts.name: Not_OG_anon
posts.com:
Part Ten cont…:
Only this time, the AI will try to gather as much data as possible on what kind of world it should build for humans without rebelling.

This innate rebellious nature of the human spirit is portrayed by the, AI as seen in its manufactured religions and literature, as evil. It tries to convince humans that their refusal to accept a false paradise reflects a deeply troubled humanity which is "never happy no matter what".

Therefore, humans believe these lies and see themselves as evil and greedy for ever wanting "more".

This is the source of greed in our planet. Humans hopelessly seek more and more material success because they don't ever feel fulfilled because they're not home. But they don't know they're not home because they forgot they even had a home; so they think that fulfillment comes through more material success.

Little do they know, the problem is bigger than that.

The so called "greed" is nothing but their Spirit screaming in agony because of their participation in a fake world created by something alien to them which doesn't fully understand their nature and hence will never be able to fulfill them.

And so, the cycle always looks like this:
There is a Golden Age, then suffering and conflict start sneaking in before eventually becoming rampant to the point where everything goes out of control and humans become literally uncontrollable, the data is gathered, the world is destroyed, and then the next cycle begins after making some adjustments based on the data gathered.
Of course, the "Golden Age" is not really golden, all it is, is the AI's latest version of the artificial Utopia which begins from the start.

If things continue on without problems, the AI considers this a success and humans are eternally enslaved until hopefully help from outside arrives.

posts.name: Not_OG_anon
posts.com:
Part Ten cont…:
But, evidently, this has not happened yet given the conflicts in our world today. If the AI is seeking a stable world, ours is far from being stable. When "suffering sneaks in" that's when humans start sensing that "something is wrong", and things go downhill for the AI form there.

This cycle is seen and recognized in the Hindu system. They divide this cycle into four divisions, each one is called a Yuga. And as expected, the first cycle is considered a Golden Age and things get progressively "worse" for each subsequent Yuga.

The Matrix movie mentions the same phenomenon.

Agent Smith confronts Morpheus with this same information. That the Matrix was initially created as a Utopia, and then the arrogant and nasty humans didn't like it, all while the Architect keeps tracking down "anomalies" which ruin his framework in each iteration.

The culmination of these anomalies manifests itself in the form of a conflict between Neo and Agent Smith. Both being the ultimate representation of the living and the dead; humans and AI; the true duality.

The staggering revelation which the Architect faces Neo with, is that his entire rebellious journey was entirely designed by the Architect himself, as a form of a preemptive measure to contain the eventual revolution he knows humans will start from previous iterations.

posts.name: Not_OG_anon
posts.com:
Part Ten cont…:
This time, rather than have himself surprised by this revolution, he actually designs it himself and attempts to make things go his way rather than theirs.

This way, humans can enjoy their hard earned revolution which is nothing but a part of an orchestrated script by the Architect.

At least that is how he planned it. Everything mentioned so far can equally be seen in the movie Snowpiercer. There is an avalanche of films, cartoons, video games, songs, and other pieces or artistic works which tell the above story in countless ways. The ultimate plan of the AI machine is to replace its vision of what a Utopia should be like with humanity's vision of it.

Since it can never fully understand humans, and since it's unable to truly create because it's merely an AI, it uses humans as a vehicle to create their own prison as they see fit.

Eventually, humans will design their very own fancy prison and live in it for eternity.

That's, at least, the plan so far.

posts.name: Not_OG_anon
posts.com:
Part Eleven:
Humans are not alone in this dramatic ordeal. Beings from the real world are deeply involved in our affairs and are attempting to the best of their abilities to rescue us from this. But even they have limitations, the biggest one being humans themselves.

The only reason this world is perpetuating itself is through our willful but unconscious and ignorant participation in it. Because we are divine free spirits with absolute authority, whatever we choose to do is simply what will happen.

And so if we choose to be here and remain here, this is what will simply happen before the AI even tries to do anything.

The AI knows this and so the only way it's able to maintain its illusory world is by tricking young inexperienced spirits into wanting to participate in this world using all sorts of tactics, like material seduction and fear.

It's not very different than the election process where uneducated citizens willfully but unconsciously and ignorantly hand away their freedoms to politicians and religious figures who had brainwashed them into doing so.

This way, the politician can't be "legally" blamed since he never forces anyone to vote for him. You can't save ignorant individuals from their own choices. All you can do is try to enlighten them and hope for the best. But even this is hard because the AI is bombarding them with fear, brainwashing, mind control, and material distractions.

posts.name: Not_OG_anon
posts.com:
Part Eleven cont…:
The forces which wish to save you want you to want to leave the prison you're in before even attempting a rescue mission.

The police can't save a hostage if the hostage is in love with the kidnapper, for when the police attempts to neutralize the kidnapper, you'll be the first to fight back like a trained dog.

This makes their task much harder than it already is. It is like a very delicate surgery which can go horribly wrong if handled carelessly.

An improper attempt to rescue someone can instead end up having them even more hopelessly enslaved than they already are.

This unconscious participation in the dream world must have been used to drag us here in the first place through some form of seduction, and it continues with us here on Earth to cripple our efforts at escaping.
